speaker: ナレーター
japanese: どこかへ行きましょうと言い出してみんなが賛成しました
english: Someone suggested going somewhere, and everyone agreed.

speaker: ナレーター
japanese: でもどこかがどこだかは出発する今日になっても決まりませんでした
english: But even now, on the day of departure, no one had decided where 'somewhere' actually was.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: ママ、それみんな持っていくつもり?
english: Mama, are you planning to bring all of that?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: そうよ
english: That's right.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 私たちは船に乗るんだよ
english: We're going on a boat, you know.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: でもどこかへ行くんでしょ?
english: But we're going somewhere, right?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そりゃそうだが
english: Well, yes, but...

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: どこかへ着いたら上陸するわよね
english: When we arrive somewhere, we'll go ashore, right?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: するだろうな
english: We probably will.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: だったら火を起こしたり、コーヒーが飲みたくなったり、パンケーキが食べたくなったりするわよね
english: Then we'll want to make a fire, drink coffee, and eat pancakes, won't we?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: だろうな、子供たちも行くんだから
english: I suppose so, since the kids are coming too.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: これはそのために必要なものばかりよ
english: All of this is necessary for that purpose.

speaker: ミー
japanese: まだ行かないの?
english: Are we still not leaving?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 何?
english: What?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 気をつけないと今に落っこって怪我するわ
english: If you're not careful, you'll fall and get hurt.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 平気だよ、それよりひとりフローレン
english: I'm fine. More importantly, Floren, are you alone?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: お兄さんやっぱり行かないって
english: My brother says he's not going after all.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: どうしても今日中に設計図を仕上げたいって言ってるわ
english: He says he absolutely wants to finish the blueprints today.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: そう、たまには船に乗るのも悪くないと思ったのに
english: I see. I thought it wouldn't be bad to go on a boat once in a while.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: ねえ、まだ出かけないの?
english: Hey, are we still not leaving?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: もうすぐ支度ができるわよ
english: We'll be ready soon.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: それみんな持っていくの?
english: Are you bringing all of that?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そうだよ、これはママが集めた必要なものばかりさ
english: Yes, all of this is necessary stuff that Mama gathered.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: ねえムーミン、結局どこへ行くことにしたの?
english: Hey Moomin, where did you decide to go after all?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: パパ決めたの?
english: Did Papa decide?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: いや、まだだ
english: No, not yet.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: 珍しい花を見つけたんですか?
english: Did you find a rare flower?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: いやいや、この花はもう私のコレクションに入っている
english: No, no, this flower is already in my collection.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: 引っ越しですか、みなさん?
english: Are you all moving?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 船に乗るんですよ
english: We're going on a boat.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: ああ、例の船、まだ持ち主は現れませんか?
english: Ah, that ship - the owner still hasn't appeared?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ええ
english: No, they haven't.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: それにしても船に乗るのになんでそんな荷物がいるんです?
english: Even so, why do you need so much luggage just to go on a boat?

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: ムーミンたち、まだ来てないのか?
english: Moomin and the others haven't arrived yet?

speaker: スニフ
japanese: いや
english: No.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: 絶好の航海日和だな
english: It's perfect sailing weather.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 今日はどこへ行くのかな?
english: I wonder where we're going today.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: 僕は知らない
english: I don't know.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: あんまり遠くは嫌だな
english: I don't want to go too far.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: どうして?
english: Why?

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 僕、泳ぎ得意じゃないからね
english: I'm not good at swimming.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 嵐になって船がひっくり返ったら大変なことになるもの
english: If a storm comes and the boat flips over, it would be terrible.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: 嵐など来そうもないじゃないか
english: It doesn't look like a storm is coming at all.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: さあ、みんな乗った乗った
english: Alright, everyone get on, get on!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ママ、ミー、スナフキン、フローレン
english: Mama, My, Snufkin, Floren.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: さあ、ヘムレンさん、乗ってください
english: Now, Mr. Hemulen, please get on.

speaker: ミー
japanese: ヘムレンさんも行くの?
english: Is Mr. Hemulen coming too?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: そうじゃ、島があったら上陸するそうだから
english: Yes, I heard we'll land if there's an island.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: そこで珍しい植物を採集するんじゃ
english: I'll collect rare plants there.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 早く乗れよ
english: Hurry up and get on!

speaker: ミー
japanese: 満員だね
english: It's full, isn't it?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 大丈夫、ほら、ここが空いてるよ
english: It's fine. Look, there's space here.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 早くしろよ
english: Hurry up!

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 僕が乗ったら沈みそうだよ
english: If I get on, it looks like it'll sink.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: バカなこと言うなよ、まだ一人や二人大丈夫だよ
english: Don't say stupid things. One or two more people is still fine.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 大丈夫だよ、スニフ一人くらい、ねえ、パパ
english: It's fine, just one Sniff. Right, Papa?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ああ、今日は波も穏やかだし
english: Yes, the waves are calm today too.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: やっぱり僕やめる
english: I think I'll pass after all.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 臆病なやつ
english: Such a coward.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 出発よ
english: Let's depart!

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: スニフ、出発するぞ
english: Sniff, we're leaving!

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 僕は留守番をしてるよ、君たちの家を守ってあげる
english: I'll watch the house. I'll protect your home for you.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: だから安心して行ってらっしゃい
english: So don't worry and have a safe trip.
grammar: 行ってらっしゃい (see you off)

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 台所のテーブルの上にパンケーキがあるから、よかったら食べなさい
english: There are pancakes on the kitchen table, so eat them if you'd like.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: ありがとう
english: Thank you.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: スニフも乗ればよかったんだ
english: Sniff should have gotten on too.

speaker: ミー
japanese: スニフは泳げないのよ
english: Sniff can't swim.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 私は泳げるけど
english: I can swim, though.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 私もあんまり泳げないけど、何の心配もしてないわよ
english: I can't swim very well either, but I'm not worried at all.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 海はいいね、ママ
english: The sea is nice, isn't it, Mama?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: ええ
english: Yes.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: うん、風がすっかりなくなったな
english: Hmm, the wind has completely died down.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 櫂を使おうよ、パパ
english: Let's use the oars, Papa.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そうだな、スナフキン、協力してくれ
english: Good idea. Snufkin, help me out.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: いいですよ
english: Sure.

speaker: ミー
japanese: でももっと一生懸命漕いでみて
english: But try rowing harder!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: やってるよ
english: I am!

speaker: ミー
japanese: それで?全然動いてないじゃない
english: And? We're not moving at all!

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: 動いてるよ、ゆっくりだけど
english: We are moving, just slowly.

speaker: ミー
japanese: これじゃどこへも行けないわ
english: At this rate, we won't get anywhere!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 分かってるよ、でもこれで精一杯なんだ
english: I know, but this is the best we can do.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: どこかについてくれないと植物など採集できないな
english: If we don't arrive somewhere, I can't collect plants.
grammar: 〜てくれないと (if you don't do for me)

speaker: ミー
japanese: ヘムレンさん、諦めなさいよ、何にも見えないわ
english: Mr. Hemulen, give up. We can't see anything.

speaker: ミー
japanese: それにこのスピードじゃね
english: And at this speed...

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ヘムレンさん、今に風が出ますよ
english: Mr. Hemulen, the wind will pick up soon.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そうすればきっと一つくらい島が見つかります
english: Then we'll surely find at least one island.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: そこに島があるよ、パパ
english: There's an island over there, Papa.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: あんな小さな島、どうしようもないよ
english: An island that small is no use.
grammar: どうしようもない (can't be helped)

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 本当だ
english: You're right.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 櫂を漕いでいなくても動いてるぞ
english: We're moving even without rowing!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 風が出てきたんだよ
english: The wind has picked up.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 綺麗な島だよ、パパ
english: It's a beautiful island, Papa.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 船もつけやすいようになっている
english: It looks easy to dock the boat too.
grammar: 〜ようになっている (is set up so that)

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: ここなら珍しい植物が見つかりそうだ
english: We might find rare plants here.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: パパ、ありがとう
english: Thank you, Papa.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: お礼は植物を見つけてからでいいですよ
english: You can thank me after you find some plants.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 私、石でかまどを作るわ、みんなにコーヒーとパンケーキが出せる
english: I'll make a stone stove. Then I can serve coffee and pancakes to everyone.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 子供たち、上陸したら薪を集めてきてちょうだい
english: Children, please gather firewood after we land.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: パパ、僕もスナフキンと持って降りていくよ
english: Papa, I'll go down with Snufkin and carry things.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: よし!
english: Good!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 全部役に立つな
english: Everything is useful.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: そうよ、ピクニックは楽しいものにしないとね
english: That's right. We need to make the picnic enjoyable.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: それにしても、この島はどういう島なんだろう
english: Even so, I wonder what kind of island this is.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 何か手伝うことある?
english: Is there anything I can help with?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: そうね
english: Let me see...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 僕、島の探検がしたいんだ
english: I want to explore the island.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: どうぞ、してらっしゃい
english: Go ahead, enjoy yourself.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: うん、フローレンは?
english: Okay. What about you, Floren?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 私はママのお手伝いをするわ
english: I'll help Mama.

speaker: ミー
japanese: ママ、こんなにたくさん持ってきたわよ
english: Mama, I brought this much!

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: ありがとう、二人とも
english: Thank you, both of you.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: この島には住んでる人はいないのかな?
english: I wonder if anyone lives on this island?

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: さあね、とにかく今のところは誰も見かけないね
english: Who knows. Anyway, so far I haven't seen anyone.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 見たわ、私
english: I saw someone.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: え?誰を?
english: Huh? Who?

speaker: ミー
japanese: 小さいやつを
english: Something small.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 小さいって、どのくらい?
english: How small?

speaker: ミー
japanese: 私くらいよ
english: About my size.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: どんなやつ?
english: What kind?

speaker: ミー
japanese: よく見えなかった、だって、すぐに草の陰に隠れちゃったもの
english: I couldn't see well. It quickly hid in the grass.

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: ミーの話が本当なら、やっぱり誰かいるんだ
english: If My's story is true, then someone must be here after all.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 私を信用しないのね?
english: You don't trust me?

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: そうじゃない、見間違いだってあるからね
english: That's not it. It could have been a mistake.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: おしべが三つに、めしべが七つ、うーん、これは珍しい
english: Three stamens and seven pistils... Hmm, this is rare.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: ん?興味深い
english: Hmm? Interesting.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: こいつも珍しい、この島は珍しい植物ばかりだ
english: This one is rare too. This island is full of rare plants.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: なんだあれは
english: What's that?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: なんだ?気圧計じゃないか
english: What? Isn't that a barometer?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: おや?雨をさしてるぞ、壊れてるんじゃないのか?
english: Huh? It's pointing to rain. Is it broken?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: お前たち、こんなところで何してるんだ
english: What are you all doing here?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: そうか、この気圧計はお前たちのものなんだな
english: I see, this barometer belongs to you all.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: な、なんだ、文句でもあるのか?あるなら言ってみろ
english: Wh-what? Do you have a complaint? If so, say it!

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: ミーが言ってたのは、ニョロニョロだよ、きっと
english: What My was talking about must have been the Hattifatteners.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: え?それじゃ、ここはお化け島か
english: Huh? So this is a ghost island?

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: お化けと言っても、ニョロニョロはおとなしい奴だから、どうってことない
english: Even though they're called ghosts, Hattifatteners are quiet creatures, so it's no big deal.
grammar: どうってことない (no big deal)

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 今、助けてくれって言ったな
english: Just now, someone said 'help me.'

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: ヘムレンさんの声よ
english: That's Mr. Hemulen's voice.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: おい、助けてくれー
english: Hey, help me!

speaker: スノフキン
japanese: どうしておとなしいニョロニョロをこんなに怒らせたんですか?
english: How did you make such quiet Hattifatteners this angry?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: それがよくわからないんだが、何か気に入らないことがあったらしいよ
english: I don't really understand, but apparently something bothered them.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 何もしないのに、ニョロニョロが怒りますかね
english: Would Hattifatteners get angry if you didn't do anything?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: そうじゃな、気圧計を叩いたのがまずかったのかな
english: Well, maybe hitting the barometer was a bad idea.
